0.name: Select the correct options to add the 'age' property to the 'user' object

1.name: How many properties can be added to an object?

2.name: Exactly how much has been removed
What happens if you add a property with a name that already exists in the object?

0.name: The value of the property will be changed to the new

1.name: If the object is created using the 'const' keyword, nothing will change

2.name: Adding a property will cause an error

3.name: A new property with the same name will be added
What happens if you add a property to an object that is not yet created?

0.name: An object with this property will be created

1.name: The property will be added as long as the object is declared in the further part of the code

2.name: An error will occur because you cannot add a property to an object before creating the object

4.name: Find an error in the code: const home = {}; let home.rooms = 3;

1.name: The 'home' object must be declared with the 'let' keyword

2.name: There should not be the keyword 'let' before 'home.rooms'

5.name: Is it possible to add a property that was previously removed to the object again?

6.name: Find an error in the code: const school = {}; school.students_all = '';

0.name: You cannot add a property if it contains characters other than letters and numbers

1.name: A property with a name containing '_' can only be added as 'school['students_all']'

2.name: The value of the added property cannot be empty

7.name: Can you add a property to an empty object?

8.name: Specify the options in which adding a property to an object using the 'object.property' point is not possible

0.name: The name of the property contains spaces

1.name: The name of the property begins with a number

2.name: The name of the property contains the characters '$' or '_'.

3.name: The name of the object is empty

9.name: Is it true that using square brackets 'object['property']' you can add a property with any name to an object?
